response.correct_answer: The Center of Gravity (COG) or Centroid of Area (COA) method is a defuzzification technique used in fuzzy logic to convert a fuzzy output set into a single crisp numerical value. It calculates the center of the area under the aggregated membership function of the output fuzzy set. The formula is: $COG = \frac{\int x \cdot \mu(x) dx}{\int \mu(x) dx}$, where $x$ is the output variable and $\mu(x)$ is the membership function of the aggregated fuzzy set.
